post_text: Need help paying rent, mortgage or utilities due to challenges related to COVID-19? Look into the Oakland County, Michigan Government Community & Home Improvement Relief Program.
shared_text:
Oakland County, Michigan Government
August 13 at 2:55 PM ·

#OaklandCounty residents who have fallen behind on their rent, mortgage or utility payments because of a lost job or other income reduction due to the #COVID19 pandemic may be eligible for a one-time grant of up to $15,000 per household. Applications can be found at http://ow.ly/pTaK50AuSbD.

The Rent, Mortgage & Utility Relief Program is for Citizens that will pay up to three months of past-due rent, housing or utility bills for low-income Oakland County residents who have been unable to pay their bills because of an income hardship directly related to the pandemic.

Questions, applications and supporting documentation can be submitted by email to OCHousingRelief@oakgov.com.

July 10 at 5:52 PM ·

#DYK: The #OaklandTogether #COVID19 Safety Video & Art Contest will now offer cash prizes for finalists and winners? Learn more: http://ow.ly/rr2P50AuSqi.
